title: 'We are losing our minds': Lord Heseltine hits out at reaction to his 'sexist' Theresa May comment
text:
'We are losing our minds': Lord Heseltine hits out at reaction to his 'sexist' Theresa May comment Watch | Lord Heseltine: May has a 'man-sized job' 00:38 13 March 2017 • 8:37am 
L ord Heseltine has responded to those who "chastised" him for saying Theresa May has a "man-sized" job. 
After his comment, which many have said was sexist, he has shown little remorse and said his use of language is the result of him being a "funny old fart". 
The Tory grandee told ITV's Good Morning Britain that "we are losing our minds" if this is what we get offended over. 
The Lord, who was sacked last week from his role as an adviser to the Prime Minister following his rebellion over Brexit explained that it is hard to keep up-to-date with how younger people use language. 
He said: "I think, if I may say so, I think we are losing our minds if we really think that in the most serious issue facing this country, a slip of an 83-year-old about using a phrase which everybody would have been using a few years ago is simply of anybody's interest." ‘Naive’ Brexiteers want Theresa May ‘to show her hand so they can criticise it', according to Lord Heseltine, speaking to us now on #Brexit — Good Morning Britain (@GMB) March 13, 2017 
S peaking from his home in Oxfordshire, Lord Heseltine said: "If you've lived as long as I do you do tend to get used to these things. 
"I'll give you an example - I don't use the word 'gig'. 
"You may think: 'Funny old fart'. "But what is a gig? To me, it's a party. "And 'party' has worked perfectly well all my life." 
Last week, the Lord was chastised by a Sky News presenter after a "sexist" slip-up. 
He told Sky's Sarah-Jane Mee: "I don't in any way criticise her for this, she's got a man-sized job to do and she's very busy. 
"I've been working very constructively with three different Secretaries of State in the twilight world of politics doing the job that I know how to do best". Lord Heseltine: 'She's got a man-sized job to do' @skysarahjane : 'It's a woman-size job now' #internationalwomensday https://t.co/NX9uY7Nygg — Zoe Catchpole (@mazoe) March 8, 2017 
M r Heseltine was then interrupted by the presenter, who said: "She's got a man-sized job? It's a woman-sized job now". 
Smiling, the peer said: "As I said it, I knew you wouldn't be able to resist that". 
She replied: "Well, it is International Women's Day!" 
In response, Lord Heseltine conceded: "No, you're perfectly right. I find myself chastised by you". 
Mr Heseltine also accused Brexit supporters of naivety over the Prime Minister's plans for dealing with Europe. Lord heseltine more scaremongering on good morning Britain time to retire you dinosaur pic.twitter.com/SRWfYxMi0Z — Bristol patriot (@sidparry) March 13, 2017 Lord Heseltine shows off his green weetabix topiary #gmb pic.twitter.com/tV2E53V4qK — Ginge (@DeanoB24) March 13, 2017 
H e said: "I have made it absolutely clear that Theresa May should not reveal her hand - that would be naive. 
"Of course the people who want her to do that are the Brexiteers because they're frightened that there will be some sort of compromise and they want to be able to shout loud to stop it happening. 
"The fact is their position is naive - it's naive in two ways. "First of all they want her to reveal her hand so they can criticise it. 
"But secondly - they don't seem to understand - it's not what we want, it's what the Europeans will give us. 
"I don't like saying that ... But we are the ones leaving the club (the EU) and the club will say what the new rules will be." Follow Telegraph News
